abstract: A mistake in a movie contract earned Mr. Jones an extra $15 million, and now investors are balking at picking up part of the cost.
snippet: A mistake in a movie contract earned Mr. Jones an extra $15 million, and now investors are balking at picking up part of the cost.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — If a sloppy deal by Paramount Pictures handed Tommy Lee Jones some extra aces, should movie investors get stung for the jackpot? That question, or something like it, was being debated before Los Angeles County Superior Court judge Mark V. Mooney on Monday, in a case called Marathon Funding vs. Paramount.

headline.main: Paramount in Court Over a Costly Error
